title: Kelward
author: Kelward
content: I be business man wey de into buying and selling, and na normal tin say wen customers buy di goods wey I de sell dem go pay with our fiat currency wey be naira. But since wey I don enter dis bitcoin, I de always reason weda make I advertise say my customers fit to pay for di products wey dem buy for my shop with bitcoin. So why I bring dis topic here say make una follow chuk mouth for inside di matter be say as CBN still ban cryptocurrency, weda e still make sense say make I go ahead and advertise to my customers and on social media say dem fit to make payment to me with bitcoin? I know say di primary purpose of creating bitcoin na to take make digital payments for transactions anywhere in di world. I like as di coin de decentralized, so na im make I want to key into dat original purpose, based on say na wetin I de inside. But at di same time, I no know weda I go break di law, if I give my customers di option of paying me with bitcoin, because of di CBN ban?

But since wey I don enter dis bitcoin, I de always reason weda make I advertise say my customers fit to pay for di products wey dem buy for my shop with bitcoin. So why I bring dis topic here say make una follow chuk mouth for inside di matter be say as CBN still ban cryptocurrency, weda e still make sense say make I go ahead and advertise to my customers and on social media say dem fit to make payment to me with bitcoin? I know say di primary purpose of creating bitcoin na to take make digital payments for transactions anywhere in di world. I like as di coin de decentralized, so na im make I want to key into dat original purpose, based on say na wetin I de inside. But at di same time, I no know weda I go break di law, if I give my customers di option of paying me with bitcoin, because of di CBN ban? Na better idea be this oh my brother, but truth be told, for anyone to consider either to receive Bitcoin as payment for goods or services, eh depend on how much stuff her or she dey sell or buy, because due to transaction fees and other charges, bitcoin no be the best payment medium for small scale businesses, wey wetin you dey sell na stuff between the range of #200 to #4000, but if wetin you dey sell na stuffs between the range of like #5k, #10k and above, then you go fit use Bitcoin & no wahala.. Because the aim of every business man is to minimize cost and maximize profit. But when it comes to the issue of placing advertisement, I will highly recommend you can put it in your shop, social media bio, or whatsApp status telling your customers that while you accept fiat, you also accept Bitcoin for payment.

comments.author: CryptSafe
comments.body: OP I like your idea of accepting bitcoin as a means of payment. This has been amongst the reasons why we are here. Creating awareness and promoting the adoption of bitcoin is one of our major goals. So far, there have been lots of enterprises from our local board here that are accepting bitcoin payment for quite sometime now and it has been positive and remarkable.I will like to call your attention to what you have said OP  "so why I bring dis topic here say make una follow chuk mouth for inside di matter be say as CBN still ban cryptocurrency, ". Do not get things mixed-up OP. CBN never banned Crypto currency in Nigeria, they only restricted the banks from carrying out Crypto related transactions or payment. To the best of my knowledge, p2p platforms do exist on exchange and other forms too were Nigerians have been doing transactions but the truth is that nobody wants to identify publicly to be doing Crypto transaction  for the fear of the unknown but rather choose to remain silent doing things with Crypto and bitcoin. Everybody is just careful not being the scapegoat by the efcc and others.

But at di same time, I no know weda I go break di law, if I give my customers di option of paying me with bitcoin, because of di CBN ban? Na good thing to integrate other means of payment for your business like Bitcoin but before you do that you  go consider other factors like which type of service you dey render or goods wey you dey sell. If na petty goods you dey sell then the idea of using Bitcoin to receive payment fit no make sense at the moment because of high transaction fees. Your customers no go really like to buy goods of N2000 or N3000, come pay almost the same amount or more for transaction fees except you go use lightning network. But in all no be bad idea sha as e come dey help to create awareness and promote mass adoption of bitcoin.

Abeg, no mind say de ask like newbie, I never transact am before, dat na why I want to get every minor details, so I go know weda I go do di payment in bitcoin advert or not.

comments.author: CryptopreneurBrainboss
comments.body: Quote from: Kelward on June 19, 2023, 10:32:06 PMI know say di primary purpose of creating bitcoin na to take make digital payments for transactions anywhere in di world. I like as di coin de decentralized, so na im make I want to key into dat original purpose, based on say na wetin I de inside. But at di same time, I no know weda I go break di law, if I give my customers di option of paying me with bitcoin, because of di CBN ban? Who be CBN to ban Bitcoin? CBN only ban their people dem wey be banks to no dey transact with Bitcoin and besides that one na past government na, dem dun commot the previous CBN governments from office so things supposed dey straighten up soon although I no think dem go unban banks from interacting with Bitcoin directly. Wetin this law means say you no fit buy Bitcoin or sell Bitcoin to your Banks. Why them come out with the law na dat time wey rumors been dey say some banks wan dey offer crypto exchange services. You fit run your business nothing concern CBN with wetin you dey do with your business. Nigeria never ban Bitcoin, na unless Tinubu come out to announce say all Bitcoin transaction are illegal na when you go dey reason to stop dey accept Bitcoin.You know how many businesses are operating officially for Nigeria wey dey involved with Bitcoin, your own no go different. Run your matters on the low avoid social media sha make e just be decentralized exchange between you and your customers because if you carry am go online and law enforcement agency see am dem go wan use you chop. Tax collectors go begin reason you and EFCC as well. You know Nigerian no dey like see person progress, na so dem go begin badmouth yout business wey go come dey attract unnecessary attention wey no go make sense for your business so I go advise you run the mata offline and make your cutworms donthe marketing for you when dem get better services from you.

comments.author: Doan9269
comments.body: I will advise you for more safety to your business and self, don't make a public declaration that you're accepting bitcoin for making payments in other not to attract the attention of the government agencies on you, knowing that the government have made it illegal for banks to use bitcoin as a medium of payment or perform any related transaction with bitcoin, but in your own way, you can privately make a discussion of that with your customers who are into bitcoin or who preferred making use of bitcoin for payment, just stay away from government threats on this.

comments.author: Mate2237
comments.body: There is no law in Nigeria that the citizens should not use bitcoin. CBN only tell banks not to do any transactions with bitcoin and not individuals  so you can do your things. If anyone dey there to pay u bitcoin collect am and na so small small u go dey do until u go get plenty customers wey go pay you bitcoin through selling and buying. Since when this happens I never hear or see any law enforcement agencies harassed any bitcoinners in we country. If really piple pay goods with bitcoin oboy I go sell that thing wotowoto. I no go even fear sae government go come dey harass me. But I go dey do am with coded way.

comments.body: E no be bad thing say make naija guy dey run him biz and collect him pepper via bitcoin but the thing be say we suppose really understand say no be about using the payment system of bitcoin but na to understand the reality say if you hodl btc for your wallet,  the thing fit increase or reduce, that na the fluctuation. We need to prepare about that and to know the kind of business wey det involve. Like now small businesses no go good for bitcoin because the fees go make customer's to dey discouraged.

comments.author: lagosnoir
comments.body: I've heard of people buying house for Lekki with Bitcoin. In fact, there is a developer in Idada that puts on his banner, "BTC accepted". It all boils down to personal relationships and preferences.The main thing is trust because if payment was made by bank transfer, there will be presentable evidence (in court). But if yahoo disappears with your BTC, who you go call?On the legal side, from a business point of view, there is nothing stopping two willing sides from trading by barter. I know Emefiele didn't want you rich people in Ikoyi  to be collecting rent in dollars but that didn't stop anything. So it depends on if your normal customers want to use it and there is trust. This my comment is based on local market, of course. If you are selling online, anyone who is interested can decided to accept BTC.

Pesen no go even do am sef. So I will advise you not to do am because e no go favour you and e no go favour do buy.
